intro: Neobesseya notesteinii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to New Zealand, characterized by its strap-shaped, often blue-green leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical seed pods. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
